data.name: kstidSideBarConfigureItem

data.name: kstidCaptionWRefFormat
data.comment: Format string for info bar caption; {0} is the basic caption, {1} is the book, chapter, verse reference

data.name: kstidCaptionInBackTrans
data.comment: Format string for info bar caption when focus in in back translation pane; {0} is the caption with or without ref, {1} is the name of the back translation writing system

data.name: kstidHelpText
data.comment: General-purpose context help string

data.name: kstidImport
data.comment: Undo/Redo string for File/Import

data.name: kstidSupportEmail
data.comment: Email address for sending bug reports to

data.name: kstidImportNoBookError
data.value: No Standard Format files were found for the import range {0}-{1}
data.comment: Message text when an import contains no books.

data.name: kstidImportingBook
data.comment: Display for Progress Dialog when importing (Parameter will be a vernacular book name)

data.name: kstidImportingBackTranslation
data.comment: Display for Progress Dialog when importing a back translation (Parameter will be a vernacular book name)

data.name: kstidImportingAnnotations
data.comment: Display for Progress Dialog when importing Annotations (Parameter will be a vernacular book name)

data.name: kstidImportFinalizing
data.comment: Status message in progress dialog when import is finishing and views are being refreshed

data.name: kstidImportProgressCaption
data.comment: This is the text in the caption of the importing progress dialog box.

data.name: kstidImportInitializing
data.comment: Status message in progress dialog when import is initializing

data.name: kstidBooksToExportSingularForm
data.comment: This is the text in the label of the Export USFM dialog box when only one book matches the filter.

data.name: kstidExportPT6Overwrite
data.value:
Paratext Project "{0}" exists. Do you want to update it?
This will modify the Paratext project settings and language definition files and replace existing data files for the exported book(s).
data.comment: Message in confirmation dialog when exporting to Paratext project that already exists.

data.name: kstidExportPT6ProjReadOnly
data.value: Paratext Project "{0}" is not editable. Choose another project or change "{0}" to be editable.
data.comment: Message in confirmation dialog when attempting to export to a Paratext project that is not editable.

data.comment: This is the name of the checking toolbar as it shows up in the toolbar configuration feature

data.comment: This is the insert category for toolbar items. This string is used in the dialog that allows users to customize their toolbars.

data.comment: This is the goto category for toolbar items. This string is used in the dialog that allows users to customize their toolbars.

data.name: kstidCheckingCategory
data.comment: This is the checking category for toolbar items. This string is used in the dialog that allows users to customize their toolbars.

data.comment: Tool tip for Insert Section toolbar button

data.value: Are you sure that you want to delete {0}?
data.comment: Used to get user confirmation before removing book

data.comment: Undo/Redo text for removing a book

data.comment: Displayed as user prompt in an empty book title paragraph

data.name: kstidSectionHeadUserPrompt
data.comment: Displayed as user prompt in an empty section head paragraph

data.name: kstidUndoRedoScriptureProperties
data.comment: undo/redo tag for scripture properties changes

data.name: kstidNoDifferencesCaption
data.comment: Caption for message box displayed when Compare/Merge option of import finds no differences

data.name: kstidCreatingPublicationsCaption
data.comment: This is the status message for the progress dialog when creating publications and factory header/footer sets during a new project

data.name: kstidCreatingPublicationsStatusMsg
data.comment: This is the caption for the progress dialog when creating publications and factory header/footer sets during a new project

data.name: kstidBasedOnContext
data.comment: This is the text in the WS combo box that tells the import to set the WS based on the context of the text.

data.comment: Undo/Redo string for Insert Picture

data.name: kstidIgnoreUnrenderedToolTip

data.comment: The tooltip for the toolbar button that ignores specifying a vernacular equivalent of a biblical term.

data.name: kstidInsertAnnotation
data.comment: Used for formatting the undo/redo labels for inserting annotations

data.name: kstidSetAnnotationCategory
data.comment: Used for formatting the undo/redo labels for setting annotation category

data.name: kstidDeleteAnnotation
data.comment: Used for formatting the undo/redo labels for deleting notes

data.name: kstidImportAnnotations
data.comment: Used for formatting the undo/redo labels for importing notes (OXESA file import)

data.name: kstidImportKeyTerms
data.comment: Used for formatting the undo/redo labels for importing key term renderings (OXEKT file import)

data.name: kstidFilterNameTemplate
data.comment: Template for showing filter names in the filter menu

data.name: kstidLoadKeyTermsInDBCaption
data.comment: This is the text in the caption of the progress dialog when TE starts up and loads biblical terms into the DB for the first time.

data.name: kstidLoadKeyTermsInDBStatus
data.comment: This is the status text in the progress dialog shown as TE loads biblical terms into the DB for the first time.

data.name: kstidLoadKeyTermsLocalizations
data.comment: This is the status text in the progress dialog shown as TE begins to load localized versions of biblical terms for the current UI locale (parameter is the language name).

data.name: kstidCreateResponse
data.comment: Used for formatting the undo/redo labels for creating annotation responses

data.name: kstidProjectInaccessible
data.value: Standard Format files are not available
data.comment: Error message when import cannot proceed due to inaccessible files.

data.name: kstidImportFilesAreUnavailable
data.value: Project files are unavailable for import.
data.comment: Import error message

data.name: kstidStopImporting
data.comment: Stop button text on the import progress dialog.

data.name: kstidStoppingImport
data.comment: Progress bar message

data.name: kstidConfirmStopImport
data.value: If you stop importing right now, you will have successfully imported everything up to and including {0}. Are you sure you want to stop importing? (Click No to continue importing.)
data.comment: MessageBox prompt

data.name: kstidExportDlgFolderBrowserPrompt
data.comment: Prompt shown on folder browser dialog, brought up from the export usfm dialog.

data.name: kstidExportPtxDlgFolderBrowserPrompt
data.value: Select a folder in which to place your project.
data.comment: Prompt shown on folder browser dialog, brought up from the export Paratext dialog.

data.name: kstidExportDlgParatext
data.comment: Label to be used in Export dialog when Paratext markup is selected

data.name: kstidExportDlgMultipleBooks
data.comment: Label to be used in Export dialog that gets added to the books, when there are less then 4 books

data.name: kstidExportDlgFiltered
data.comment: Label to be used in Export dialog that gets added to the books, when there is a filter set

data.name: kstidExportDlgUnfiltered
data.comment: Label to be used in Export dialog that gets added to the books, when there is not a filter set

data.name: kstidExportDlgToolbox
data.comment: Label to be used in Export dialog when Toolbox markup is selected

data.name: kstidFileExists
data.value: File already exists. Would you like to overwrite it?
data.comment: Text to be used in Export message dialog when specified file already exists.

data.name: kstidMissingBackTranslationText
data.comment: Text that is shown for missing back translation paragraphs in an RTF export.

data.name: kstidExportRtfKtHeader
data.comment: Header text for the RTF Biblical Terms export

data.name: kstidExportRtfKtMissingRendering
data.comment: Text for the Missing Rendering category of biblical term references in the RTF export

data.name: kstidExportRtfKtIntentionallyNotRendered
data.comment: Text for the Intentionally Not Rendered category of biblical term references in the RTF export

data.name: kstidExportUSFMMissingFileName
data.comment: Text for error message in USFM export dialog when file name is missing

data.name: kstidOpenSampleDbMsg
data.value:
Do you want to study the training course for Translation Editor?
If you click Yes, the Sena 3 sample project will open. On the Help menu, point to Training, and then click Student Manual.
To begin working in Translation Editor or to get quick-start help, click No.
data.comment: Yes/No question for first-time users to ask if they want to open the sample database

data.name: kstidGenerateSectionTemplate
data.comment: Undo/Redo string for Generate Section Template

data.name: kstidDiffDlgUndoRedoEditNote
data.comment: Used for the Undo/Redo label when a note's edits are collapsed into one undo task.

data.name: kstidHelpTrainingFileNotFound
data.value: The training file {0} could not be opened.
data.comment: Error message that shows when one of the training files could not be opened.

data.name: kstidUndoRedoAssignVern
data.comment: Used for Undo/Redo label when assigning a vernacular equivalent in biblical key terms view.

data.name: kstidMultipleStyleExportCodes
data.value: The style {0} is mapped to multiple Standard Format markers for export. The first one ({1}) will be used.
data.comment: This error can only happen if someone sets up TeStyles.xml wrong

data.name: kstidSeparateCrossRef
data.comment: This appears on the footnote tab of the scripture properties dialog when the cross references and the general footnotes are combined

data.name: kstidCombineCrossRef
data.comment: This appears on the footnote tab of the scripture properties dialog when the cross references and the general footnotes are separated

data.name: kstidExportUsfmErrorTryReinstall
data.comment: Error message that appears in a message box when USFM export throws an exception because installed file is missing or corrupt.

data.name: kstidExportUsfmFileError
data.comment: Error message that appears in a message box when USFM export fails unexpectedly.

data.name: kstidUndoRedoChangeBackTransStatus
data.comment: Undo/Redo text for changing the back translation status

data.name: kstidCorrectionLayoutView
data.comment: Scripture task--This text will appear in Sidebar, Views menu, and Information Bar

data.name: kstidCheckParatextInstallation
data.value: Problem communicating with Paratext. Please ensure that Paratext is correctly installed.
data.comment: Error message when we are unable to load the Paratext objects required for importing a Paratext project

data.name: kstidParatextProjectLoadFailure
data.value: Paratext Project {0} could not be loaded. Please ensure that Paratext is correctly installed and that it can open this project.
data.comment: Error message when we are unable to load a Paratext project

data.name: kstidToolsToolBarText
data.comment: This is the name of the Tools toolbar as it shows up in the toolbar configuration feature

data.name: kstidEditorialChecks
data.comment: Checking--This text will appear in Sidebar, Views menu, and Information Bar

data.name: kstidHelpTopicAllStyles
data.comment: Help topic that is displayed when no style is selected

data.name: kstidUndoRedoIgnoreVern
data.comment: Undo/Redo text for Keyterm Not Rendered Explicitly

data.name: kstidUndoRedoVernNotAssigned
data.comment: Undo/Redo text for Vernacular Equivalent of Keyterm not Assigned

data.name: kstidScrCheckNameFormat
data.comment: Format string for the scripture checks displayed in the EditorialChecksControl tree. The first parameter is the check's name, the second is the date/time or the value of kstidScrCheckNeverRunMsg if the check was not run on one or more scripture books.

data.name: kstidScrCheckNeverRunMsg
data.comment: Message displayed next to a scripture check name when the check has never been run on one or more scripture books. This is displayed instead of the last date/time the check was run.

data.name: kstidScrCheckRunDateTimeFormat
data.comment: Format string for displaying the date/time of the last run for a check. This is displayed next to the scripture check's name.

data.name: kstidUndoEditScrChkErrAnnotation
data.comment: undo/redo text for editing a comment for an ignored scripture check inconsistency.

data.name: kstidScrChkNameSeparator
data.comment: Text used to separate the names of the selected scripture checks in checking view when the checking toolbar is docked to the top. This separator should also include the space, if desired.

data.name: kstidUndoRedoResolutionStatusChange
data.comment: Undo/Redo text for Ignoring/Not Ignoring Checking Resolution Status Change

data.name: kstidEnglishVersification
data.comment: Name of versification system

data.name: kstidOriginalVersification
data.comment: Name of versification system

data.name: kstidRussianOrthodoxVersification
data.comment: Name of versification system

data.name: kstidRussianProtestantVersification
data.comment: Name of versification system

data.name: kstidSeptuagintVersification
data.comment: Name of versification system

data.name: kstidVulgateVersification
data.comment: Name of versification system

data.name: kstidStyleFromImport
data.comment: format string for filling in usage field of a style creating during import. {0} is the name of the file we imported.

data.name: kstidNoDeuteroCanonical
data.value: Sorry, but Translation Editor does not handle Deutero-Canonical books.
data.comment: import warning message

data.name: kstidMigratingKeyTermReferences
data.value: Copying data to the new biblical terms list
data.comment: This is the status text in the progress dialog shown as TE copies assigned vernacular equivalents form the old biblical terms list to the new one.

data.name: kstidImportXmlBadFile
data.value: {0} is not a valid OXES file.
data.comment: {0} is a file pathname

data.name: kstidSavedVersionDescriptionOriginal
data.comment: Name of saved version that is a copy of original books before import changed them.

data.name: kstidIdentical
data.value: No differences found in vernacular text (back translation not compared)
data.comment: Status value displayed in Imported Book dialog when there are no differences between the imported version of a book and the current version

data.name: kstidNoDifferencesLeft
data.comment: Status value displayed in Imported Book dialog when there are no more differences to be reviewed.

data.name: kstidNewBook
data.comment: Status value displayed in Imported Book dialog when the imported version of the book is the only one (no pre-existing versions of that book)

data.name: kstidImportXmlLangMismatch
data.value: The project's vernacular language ({0}) does not match the OXES file's data language ({1}). Should import continue?
data.comment: {0} and {1} are both language (writing system) identifiers

data.name: kstidInitialDifferences
data.comment: Status value displayed in Imported Book dialog when there are differences between the imported version of a book and the current version

data.name: kstidImportXmlLangMismatchCaption
data.comment: message box caption

data.name: kstidImportXmlNotAFile
data.comment: {0} is supposedly a file pathname (but it's not!)

data.name: kstidOverwrittenFull
data.value: Imported version has replaced current version
data.comment: Status value displayed in Imported Book dialog when user has chosen to replace the current version of a book with the imported version

data.name: kstidImportXmlWarning
data.comment: message box caption

data.name: kstidIncompleteValidCharsForCharCheckMsg
data.value: Before you can select the Characters check, you must add more characters in the Word Forming area of the Valid Characters dialog box. Would you like to do so now?
data.comment: Content for message box alerting the user that the valid characters list is incomplete. This message is shown in the editorial checks view when the user tries to select the characters check when the valid characters list is incomplete.

data.name: kstidImportNoOxesBookError
data.value: No books were found in the OXES file for the import range {0}-{1}.
data.comment: Message text when an import contains no books.

data.name: kstidStandardFormatImportSvDesc
data.comment: Default description for saved version created by standard format import.

data.name: kstidDetailsLabel
data.comment: This text will appear as a label for the Details field for an ignored inconsistency in the Notes window.

data.name: kstidMessageLabel
data.comment: This text will appear as a label for the Message field for an ignored inconsistency in the Notes window.

data.name: kstidOxesInvalidParaInsidePara
data.value:
Invalid context for

element in paragraph data just before line {0}.
data.comment: {0} is a number

data.name: kstidOxesUnexpectedInsideBook
data.value: Found unexpected <{0}> inside <book> at line {1} character {2}.
data.comment: {0} is an XML element name, {1} and {2} are numbers

data.name: kstidOxesUnexpectedInsideParaData
data.value: Found unexpected <{0}> in paragraph data just before line {1}.
data.comment: {0} is an XML element name and {1} is a number

data.name: kstidOxesUnexpectedInsideTrGroup
data.value: Found unexpected <{0}> inside <trGroup> just before line {1}.
data.comment: {0} is an XML element name and {1} is a number

data.name: kstidOxesImportOf
data.comment: {0} is the description read from the OXES file

data.name: kstidExportingMessage
data.comment: Exporting progress message for Biblical Terms export

data.name: kstidSelectingMessage
data.comment: Selecting message during export of Biblical Terms to RTF file progress

data.name: kstidEditorialChkVwStatusTextFmt
data.value: {0} To move to the next inconsistency, press Alt+Down Arrow.
data.comment: Status bar text when the user is in the editorial checks view. The parameter is the portion of the status bar text that's present for every view.

data.name: kstidKeyTermsVwStatusTextFmt
data.value: {0} To move to the next biblical term occurrence, press Alt+Down Arrow.
data.comment: Status bar text when the user is in the biblical terms view. The parameter is the portion of the status bar text that's present for every view.

data.name: kstidConfirmUseThisVersion
data.value: Using this version will cause the highlighted text in the current version to be deleted. Are you sure you want to do this?
data.comment: MessageBox prompt used in Compare and Merge dialog box

data.name: kstidConfirmUseThisVersionCaption
data.comment: Message Box caption used in Compare and Merge dialog box

data.name: kstidDataLossCaption
data.comment: Caption for message displayed in Imported Books dialog box and Saved and Imported Versions dialog box

data.name: kstidDataLossMsg
data.comment: Message displayed in Imported Books dialog box and Saved and Imported Versions dialog box (parameter 0 is "imported" or "saved"; parameter 1 is the name of the book, parameter 2 is the list of content that will be deleted)

data.name: kstidImported
data.comment: The article, adjective and noun are included to accomodate languages with different word order.

data.name: kstidSaved
data.comment: The article, adjective and noun are included to accomodate languages with different word order.

data.name: kstidUpdateKeyTermEquivalentsProgressCaption
data.comment: Progress dialog message

data.name: kstidUpdateKeyTermEquivalentsProgressLoading
data.comment: Progress dialog message

data.name: kstidUpdateKeyTermEquivalentsProgressMessage
data.comment: Progress dialog message

data.name: kstidNoMatchedPairsForCheckMsg
data.value: The Matching Punctuation Pairs list is empty. You must add pairs before you can run the Matching Punctuation Pairs Check. Would you like to do so now?
data.comment: Content for message box alerting the user that there are no matching punctuation pairs defined for the writing system. This message is shown in the editorial checks view when the user tries to select the Matching Punctuation Pairs check when none are defined.

data.name: kstidNoPuncPatternsForCheckMsg
data.value: The Punctuation Patterns list is empty. You must add punctuation patterns before you can run the Punctuation Check. Would you like to do so now?
data.comment: Content for message box alerting the user that there are no punctuation patterns defined for the writing system. This message is shown in the editorial checks view when the user tries to select the punctuation check when no patterns are defined.

data.name: kstidNoQuotationMarksForCheckMsg
data.value: There are no quotation marks specified. You must specify at least first level quotation marks before you can run the Quotations Check. Would you like to do so now?
data.comment: Content for message box alerting the user that there are no quotation marks defined for the writing system. This message is shown in the editorial checks view when the user tries to select the quotations check when none are defined.

data.name: kstidOneRemainingDifference
data.comment: Status value displayed in Imported Book dialog when there is one unreviewed differences between the imported version of a book and the current version after using the Compare and Merge dialog box.

data.name: kstidAutoMerged
data.comment: Status value displayed in Imported Book dialog box when the imported version of the book contains new material that has been merged in successfully (i.e., without having to replace any existing material).

data.name: kstidOneInitialDifference
data.comment: Status value displayed in Imported Book dialog when there is one difference between the imported version of a book and the current version

data.name: kstidOverwrittenPartial
data.value: Imported section(s) have replaced {0} section(s) in current version
data.comment: Status value displayed in Imported Book dialog when user has chosen to replace the current version of a book with the imported version

data.name: kstidRemainingDifferences
data.comment: Status value displayed in Imported Book dialog when there are still unreviewed differences between the imported version of a book and the current version after using the Compare and Merge dialog box.

data.name: kstidConfirmBookOverwriteAfterMerge
data.value:
You have reviewed some differences between the imported version and the current version of {0}.
Do you want to replace the range in the current version with the imported version?
To keep the decisions you made in the Compare and Merge Versions dialog box, click No.
data.comment: Message displayed in Imported Books dialog box (parameter 0 is the name of the book) if user clicks Overwrite button after using the Compare and Merge dialog box to merge one or more of the differences.

data.name: kstidConfirmOverwriteBackTransCaption
data.value: Confirm Potential Loss of Back Translation
data.comment: Caption on message box displayed in Imported Books dialog box if user confirms that they want to Replace Range in a book even though they may lose back translation data.

data.name: kstidConfirmOverwriteBackTrans
data.comment: Message displayed in Imported Books dialog box if user confirms that they want to Replace Range in a book even though they may lose back translation data. Parameter 0: "imported" or "saved", Parameter 1: language name, Parameter 2: book name, Parameter 3: Scripture references

data.name: kstidOverwriting
data.comment: Progress dialog message displayed when overwriting the current version with the saved or imported version.

data.name: kstidIntro
data.comment: Text used to partially describe a book reference when the book contains an introduction along with a range of Scripture references (e.g. Imported Books dialog and Saved Versions dialog)

data.name: kstidIntroOnly
data.comment: Text describing a book reference when the book contains only an introduction (e.g. Imported Books dialog and Saved Versions dialog)

data.name: kstidOFDTitle
data.comment: Title of OpenFile dialog in Import Wizard.

data.name: kstidNoBooks
data.comment: Shown in the file list under book names when the file can not be found

data.name: kstidFileMissing
data.comment: Shown in the file list under encoding for files that can not be found

data.name: kstidImportFileNoBooks
data.value: The file "{0}" does not contain any valid books.
data.comment: Shown when the user attempts to add a file to import that does not have any valid books.

data.name: kstidUnsupportedEncoding
data.value: The file "{0}" contains an unsupported encoding of {1}. Please convert this file manually and also contact the developers.

data.name: kstidUndefinedWritingSystemDetails
data.comment: Occurs if the writing system is unknown during an OXES import.

data.name: kstidNoExportStartupMsg
data.comment: Shown during startup if the FieldWorks project is associated with a Paratext project.

data.name: kstidParatextExportNotAvailable
data.comment: Shown when the user tries to export to Paratext if the FieldWorks project is associated with a Paratext project.
